channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 07/12/24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/12/07/something-for-the-weekend-07-12-24/

I hope you’ve all been making good progress on your Advent calendars, whether it’s a simple chocolately one – perhaps grabbed on clearance now that we’re over a quarter of the way through it – a bougie savoury farm shop one, or one that’s filled with treats for your cat or dog.

Christmas has come early (or is coming early) for Xbox gamers and Indiana Jones fans, with MachineGames doing a great job in retranslating the whole archeological action adventure as a first person game instead of a third person adventure.

But first, let’s check in on the news.

In the News This Week

  • Ubisoft is shutting down XDefiant, lays off hundreds of developers
  • Blizzard is removing original Warcraft I and II from GOG store
  • “They come from the water” in sci-fi horror shooter Deepest Fear
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 release brought forward by a week – console performance mode confirmed
  • Sony release My First Gran Turismo to celebrate PlayStation’s 30th anniversary
  • The Alters demo now available for PC and consoles
  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault is coming in 2025
  • Surprise! The Thing Remastered has been released
  • Escape Simulator 2 will bring even more escape rooms to get out of
  • Revenge of the Savage Planet will serve up its dish in May 2025
  • SpaceCraft is the new game from Shiro Games
  • Commandos: Origins release has been pushed to March 2025

Games in Review & Featured Articles

We brought the reviews this week, with a last mad rush for the start of December. Indiana Jones might not have topped this list, but it’s definitely a game I recommend checking out – it’ll pair very well with daily training in Fitness Boxing 3!

  • 3D Don’t Die, Mr. Robot – PC – 9/10
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle – XSX|S, PC – 8/10 (Video Review)
  • Fitness Boxing 3: Your Personal Trainer – NSW – 8/10
  • Infinity Nikki – PS5, PC, iOS, Android – 8/10
  • Loco Motive – NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Nikoderiko: The Magical World – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Mythwrecked: Ambrosia Island – XSX|S, XBO, NSW, PC – 7/10

Outside of the reviews, I checked out the new update for Warhammer 40,000: Darktide – Grim Protocols, with a new mission and a new escalating Havoc challenge mode. In stark contrast, there was also some time spent with the pun-laden museum management of Two Point Museum!

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured Infinity Nikki, Phasmo, and Indy.

Trailer Park

Project Mugen is now Ananta – see the new trailer for the anime ‘urban open world’ game

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has a new story trailer

Short Trip, a scenic tram ride for cats, is coming to Steam

Sci-fi horror shooter Deepest Fear looks pretty rad

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
